definition: standard (hotel) room/two-person room of standard size and amenities/abbr. to 标间

mark/sign/label/to mark with a symbol, label, lettering etc/to bear (a brand name, registration number etc)/prize/award/bid/target/quota/(old) the topmost branches of a tree/visible symptom/classifier for military units
to allow/to grant/in accordance with/in the light of
gap/to separate/to thin out (seedlings)/to sow discontent
between/among/within a definite time or space/room/section of a room or lateral space between two pairs of pillars/classifier for rooms

sentences.english: The room rate is RMB 466 per night.
sentences.chinese: 标准间的价格是每晚466元。

sentences.english: Would you like a luxury room and a standard room?
sentences.chinese: 你是要一个豪华间和一个标准间吗？

sentences.english: The rooms are very basic, but clean.
sentences.chinese: 房间是标准间，也挺干净的。

sentences.english: I want to book a standard room.
A standard room is slightly cheaper, at about $157 a night.
sentences.chinese: 一个标准间稍便宜，约157美元一晚。

sentences.english: The process of closing the space between standards.
sentences.chinese: 缩小两个标准间的距离的过程。

sentences.english: The standard rooms in this hotel are single rooms.
sentences.chinese: 这酒店的标准间都是单人房来的。

sentences.english: Hello, I want a standard room.
Does the customer really know the difference between your standard room and your deluxe room?
sentences.chinese: 客户是否真的了解你的标准间和豪华间的区别所在？

sentences.english: He booked two standard rooms at the hotel in the name of me.
sentences.chinese: 他以我的名义在酒店定了两个标准间。

sentences.english: I need a standard room and a suite.
sentences.chinese: 我需要一个标准间和一个套房。

sentences.english: Whether you need standard room or luxury room please let me know in advance.
sentences.chinese: 需要标准间，还是大床房，请提前告知。

definition: abbr. for 標準間|标准间[biao1 zhun3 jian1], standard (hotel) room
hotel room with one double (or queen or king) bed
